title: Breaking the current limitation of electrochemical CO2 reduction via a silica-hydroxide cycle
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE00448E, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Chulwan Lim, Sangkuk Kim, Ji Hwan Song, Man Ho Han, Young-Jin Ko, Kwan-Young Lee, Jae-Young Choi, Woong Hee Lee, Hyung-Suk Oh
We introduce a silica-hydroxide cycle analogous to Earth's carbonate-silicate cycle. The silica-hydroxide cycle reduces the local pH by redistributing hydroxide ions, enhances the CO2 mass transfer, breaking current density limits in CO2RR.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
